0867be1d-f16a-43ba-80bc-c72a082a6628.description: Earners of the Collaboration badge have exhibited foundational competency in their collaboration and teamwork skills. Earners have shown their capacity to work productively with different individuals and groups toward a common goal; know how to strengthen relationships by incorporating diverse perspectives; use active listening skills; focus on solutions rather than problems.
0867be1d-f16a-43ba-80bc-c72a082a6628.name: Collaboration

issuer.summary: issued by Minnesota State IT Center of Excellence

entity.name: Minnesota State IT Center of Excellence

alignments.name: Education Design Lab 21st Century Skills Micro-credentials

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge completed four performance-based assessments, grounded in workplace scenarios, during a for-credit course or a co-curricular activity associated with a Minnesota State college or university.  Those assessments evaluated their abilities to A) strengthen relationships, B) listen actively, C) incorporate diverse perspective, and D) focus on solutions.

2fa363bf-5c37-40f7-bbf0-a3bbb5c8d103.description: Earners of the Initiative badge have exhibited foundational competency in their initiative and leadership skills. Earners are able to demonstrate self-efficacy, show the capacity to identify needs and respond proactively; demonstrate self-awareness; learn from both "failure" and "success," seeing them as opportunities to learn and develop; lead without an official "leader" role or title; motivate others and catalyze necessary action.
2fa363bf-5c37-40f7-bbf0-a3bbb5c8d103.name: Initiative

issuer.summary: issued by Minnesota State IT Center of Excellence

entity.name: Minnesota State IT Center of Excellence

alignments.name: Education Design Lab 21st Century Skills Micro-credentials

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge completed four performance-based assessments, grounded in workplace scenarios, during a for-credit course or a co-curricular activity associated with a Minnesota State college or university.  Those assessments evaluated their abilities to A) lead without title, B) act as catalyst, C) demonstrate self-awareness, and D) learn from experience.

5d23bcf8-a436-4561-b411-afec2350fad1.description: Earners of the Oral and Written Communications badge have exhibited foundational competency of their verbal and nonverbal communication skills. Earners can speak with clarity and precision in formal and informal contexts; use stories to communicate ideas; are aware of their audience; use appropriate tone and word choice; are active listeners who can "hear" both what is said and what is not said; can use body language effectively; can write effective, professional emails.
5d23bcf8-a436-4561-b411-afec2350fad1.name: Oral and Written Communications

issuer.summary: issued by Minnesota State IT Center of Excellence

skills.name: Use Appropriate Tone And Word Choice

f059bdc5-6627-44af-9405-4fd465cd374f.description: Earners of the Critical Thinking badge have exhibited foundational competency in their critical thinking skills. 2e9f361d-c1dd-4eee-a8ed-e7e44923ce03.description: Earners of the Intercultural Fluency badge have exhibited the foundational competency of recognizing and challenging their own cultural biases. d99097d3-db07-4ef4-992c-954f73250d98.description: In this competition, CCDC college student teams compete against a “Red Team” of professionals who try to hack and infiltrate student networks. 04cd36aa-0af5-4e19-8935-2ade74100dfd.description: The Minnesota State IT Center of Excellence hosts the annual Data Derby Minnesota. This multidisciplinary competition is open to students at all Minnesota State institutions, which allows student teams to compete and present data-driven answers to defined problems and societal issues.
04cd36aa-0af5-4e19-8935-2ade74100dfd.name: Data Derby 1st Place Novice Group

issuer.summary: issued by Minnesota State IT Center of Excellence

entity.name: Minnesota State IT Center of Excellence

badge_template_activities.title: The Data Derby challenge events provide opportunities to showcase your ability to address data challenges as you see fit. Programming or SQL knowledge is helpful but not essential to winning in the Data Derby. You may use any use any openly available tool or application including: Spreadsheets Statistical packages Common programming languages (such as Java, Python, and SQL) Visualization tools (such as Tableau and SAP) packages Common office productivity tools (such as Microsoft Office Suite)

a248b146-d392-4867-bfbc-e90739bb1505.description: Candidates understand the framework for business architecture. Candidates understand the tools used to solve business problems. They know how to define the current state of a situation and identify a desired future state. They know to use mapping to design a strategy to bridge current state to future state. These candidates understand the communication needed at all levels of the organization to move their business strategies to executed initiatives that keep the customer at the forefront.
a248b146-d392-4867-bfbc-e90739bb1505.name: Business Architecture Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Minnesota State IT Center of Excellence

entity.name: Minnesota State IT Center of Excellence

alignments.name: Metro State is a Guild Accredited Training Provider ® for the Business Architecture Guild®
alignments.description: The Business Architecture Guild offers a Guild Accredited Training Partner (GATP®) program that evaluates training provider courses to ensure alignment to the BIZBOK® Guide, the standard body of knowledge for the maturing field of business architecture.

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in 15 class session. Complete a required business architecture fictional case study as a capstone project. Present case study conclusions and insights learned
